item.title: UBS Sheds Swiss Government Aid for Credit Suisse Takeover
item.description: The Swiss bank says it no longer needs a $10 billion backstop or liquidity lines.

item.title: Gilt Yields Rise After Above-Forecast UK GDP Data
item.description: Gilt yields rose after the latest U.K. GDP data came in stronger than expected, raising the prospect of more BOE interest-rate rises.

item.title: Metals Fall as Rising Dollar, Weak Demand Pressure Prices
item.description: Base metals prices were falling, while gold was flat in early London trading, as a stronger dollar and weak demand in China kept pressure on prices.

item.title: Rio Tinto Says Simandou Partners Have Reached Infrastructure Agreements
item.description: Rio Tinto said agreements have been reached between companies seeking to develop the giant Simandou iron-ore project and the government of Guinea on the infrastructure needed to export the steelmaking ingredient.

item.title: UK Economy Grows Slightly More Than Expected
item.description: U.K. GDP grew 0.2% in the second quarter, helped by growing services and industrial output, despite strikes, a series of bank holidays and continued high inflation weighing on growth.

item.title: Rovio Backs Outlook, Takeover by Sega Nears Completion
item.description: Rovio reiterated its full-year guidance, and Sega received acceptances for the takeover deal from shareholders holding 96.3% of the shares.

item.title: UBS Ends Credit Suisse Loss-Protection Pact
item.description: UBS said it has terminated an agreement with the Swiss government to cover some potential losses from its acquisition of Credit Suisse and a liquidity backstop from the central bank, as it moves forward with the integration of its former rival.

item.title: USD/SGD Rises on U.S. Rates Likely Staying Higher for Longer
item.description: USD/SGD rose in the afternoon Asian session on prospects that U.S. interest rates may stay high for longer, which would boost the appeal of U.S. fixed-income assets and demand for the greenback.

item.title: Indian Shares Edge Lower Amid Lingering Worry Over U.S. Inflation
item.description: India’s Sensex edged 0.2% lower to 65536.50, erasing its opening gains amid lingering concerns over U.S. inflation.

item.title: Diamonds Are on Sale. They Won't Be Forever.
item.description: A postpandemic glut has led to falling prices for some gems, but they are likely to bounce back.

item.title: Ukraine's Sea Drones Alter Balance of Power in Black Sea
item.description: Kyiv has used the unmanned vessels to strike back at Russia’s more powerful navy and threaten Russian military supply lines and shipping lanes.

item.title: Officials of China's securities regulator told a group of domestic law firms to soften the wording of China-specific risk disclosures in overseas stock-listing documents, according to people familiar with the meeting.
item.description: Officials of China’s securities regulator told a group of domestic law firms to soften the wording of China-specific risk disclosures in overseas stock-listing documents, according to people familiar with the meeting.

item.title: Tapestry's proposed $8.5 billion acquisition of Capri would create a conglomerate with more than $12 billion in annual sales spanning the range of customers' incomes.
item.description: Tapestry’s proposed $8.5 billion acquisition of Capri would create a conglomerate with more than $12 billion in annual sales spanning the range of customers’ incomes.

item.title: U.S. stocks edged higher after the release of the inflation data, with the S&P 500 gaining less than 0.1%. The Dow and Nasdaq rose 0.2% and 0.1%, respectively.
item.description: U.S. stocks edged higher after the release of the inflation data, with the S&P 500 gaining less than 0.1%. The Dow and Nasdaq rose 0.2% and 0.1%, respectively.

item.title: Amazon is dropping dozens of its in-house brands as part of a significant reduction of its private-label operation as it works to fend off antitrust scrutiny and shore up profit.
item.description: Amazon is dropping dozens of its in-house brands as part of a significant reduction of its private-label operation as it works to fend off antitrust scrutiny and shore up profit.

item.title: Price pressures continued cooling last month, fresh inflation figures showed, likely deterring the Fed from raising interest rates at its September meeting.
item.description: Price pressures continued cooling last month, fresh inflation figures showed, likely deterring the Fed from raising interest rates at its September meeting.

item.title: U.S. spy agencies will share more intelligence with U.S. companies, NGOs and academia in a strategy that acknowledges concerns over threats such as another pandemic and increasing cyberattacks.
item.description: U.S. spy agencies will share more intelligence with U.S. companies, NGOs and academia in a strategy that acknowledges concerns over threats such as another pandemic and increasing cyberattacks.

item.title: Covid-19 infections are rising in the U.S. ahead of the autumn months when respiratory illnesses typically surge, as another offshoot of the Omicron variant gains momentum.
item.description: Covid-19 infections are rising in the U.S. ahead of the autumn months when respiratory illnesses typically surge, as another offshoot of the Omicron variant gains momentum.

item.title: Six Colombians were arrested in connection with the assassination of an Ecuadorean presidential candidate in Quito, officials with Ecuador's Interior Ministry said.
item.description: Six Colombians were arrested in connection with the assassination of an Ecuadorean presidential candidate in Quito, officials with Ecuador’s Interior Ministry said.

item.title: Special counsel Jack Smith recommended that Trump stand trial in Washington on Jan. 2, two weeks before the first votes in the Republican presidential primary will be cast in Iowa's Jan. 15 caucuses.
item.description: Special counsel Jack Smith recommended that Trump stand trial in Washington on Jan. 2, two weeks before the first votes in the Republican presidential primary will be cast in Iowa’s Jan. 15 caucuses.
